article.title: Xiangqiboard, a GUI for chinese chess

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Xiangqiboard provides a resizable board to play xiangqi against the hoichess/hoixiangqi engine.

article.sect1:
Prerequisites
Xianqiboard provides a graphical user interface to play Chinese Chess against a computer opponent. You also need an actual playing program. At this moment xiangqiboard supports HoiXiangqi by Holger Ruckdeschel. HoiXiangqi is part of the Hoichess package. Xiangqiboard is tested with Hoichess Versions 0.8.0 and 0.10.3 on Ubuntu 7.10 GNU Linux.
</sect1
Usage
Use your mouse to enter the moves.
You can change the time settings for the computer in the Time menu.
The optional sideboard provides you with a selection of the xiangqi engine feedback.
Xiangqi is also known as Chinese Chess. It is one of the most popular games. The Wikipedia article on Xiangqi is a good starting point, if you are looking for further information on the game and how to play.
Xiangqiboard uses the same Characters for the pieces of the two sides. The graphics are stored in single SVG files (scalabel vector graphics format) for each piece. You can easily change them by replacing the files. (The standard file path is /usr/share/game/xiangqiboard).
Acknowledgement
